definition: (abbr. for 嘗試錯誤|尝试错误) trial and error/failure
to test/to try/experiment/examination/test
mistake/wrong/bad/interlocking/complex/to grind/to polish/to alternate/to stagger/to miss/to let slip/to evade/to inlay with gold or silver
surname Cuo

sentences.english: The monkeys used trial and error to figure out which images cued which movements.
sentences.chinese: 猴子们会采取试错法找出用哪种行动去应对哪副图画。

sentences.english: In the end, advertising is a trial-and-error process.
sentences.chinese: 最后，广告是一个试错过程。

sentences.english: They would never admit that Science is built on trial and error.
sentences.chinese: 他们从来不承认科学其实是建立在试错的基础上的。

sentences.english: Zappos is a risk-taking organization where making mistakes is encouraged.
sentences.chinese: Zappos是一个鼓励试错且愿意承担风险的组织。

sentences.english: You can tweak these differences by hand through trial and error.
sentences.chinese: 您可以通过试错手工消除这些差异。

definition: iteration (math.)/repeated substitution
to wade across the river, feeling for footholds as one goes (idiom)/to advance cautiously, step by step/to feel one's way forward
pinyin: mo1 zhe5 shi2 tou5 guo4 he2

definition: to correct an error
practice/to put into practice/to live up to (a promise)/to carry out (a project)
to try/to attempt/CL:次[ci4]
lit. crossing the river by feeling for stones/improvise by trial-and-error/move cautiously
innovation/to bring forth new ideas/to blaze new trails
to feel about/to grope about/to fumble/to do things slowly
business model
to start from scratch
to think back over sth/to review/to revisit/to rethink/reflection/reassessment
to correct an error
to take an indirect route/to waste one's time by using an inappropriate method
exploratory
to explore/to probe
